name: Bright Star of the Eastern Sky
description:
"The story of the Star of Bethlehem appears only in the Book of Matthew. The gospel tells us that a bright star appeared in the eastern sky when Jesus was born, famously seen by a group of wise men. These biblical "Magi," sometimes called kings, now adorn nativity scenes around the world."


When I was 5 years old, I remember being the star of a play in a Christmas event. No, I wasn't the main character. I was literally a star.


I have no idea if you believe in the bible or if you're religious, but I really like the symbolism of the star. The brightest star represents hope. Hope that will lead you to the path you must take to be where you should be.

I hope you find your own star. And if you ever do, I hope you never lose sight of it.
